headline: Major THAAD Propulsion Win Might Change The Case For Investing In L3Harris Technologies (LHX)
summary: L3Harris Technologies recently secured a nearly US$400 million contract to supply additional solid rocket boost motors and Liquid Divert and Attitude Control Systems for the Missile Defense Agency’s THAAD missile defense system, building on its track record of delivering 1,000 units of each component ahead of schedule in 2024. This latest award reinforces L3Harris’s role as a key propulsion supplier on a combat-proven system with a perfect 17-for-17 THAAD intercept test record since...

This latest award reinforces L3Harris’s role as a key propulsion supplier on a combat-proven system with a perfect 17-for-17 THAAD intercept test record since...

headline: What Canada’s Military Plans Mean For Lockheed, Defense Stocks.
summary: Relations between the U.S. and its neighbor to the North have been a little rocky lately, even outside hockey arenas.  Canada recently released its “Defense Industrial Strategy,” a 58-page document that lays out the country’s vision of the world and its implications for national defense and weapons procurement.  “The world has become more volatile and dangerous, and it is more important than ever that Canada be ready and able to defend our territory, our people, and our values,” the document begins.

headline: 5 Top 2026 Stock Picks Are Companies Backed by Massive US Government Stakes
summary: In recent years, particularly under the current administration as of early 2026, the U.S. government has shifted toward some direct equity investments and partnerships in strategic private companies, often framed as efforts to bolster national security, reduce reliance on foreign supply chains (especially from China), and support key industries like semiconductors and critical minerals. This ... 5 Top 2026 Stock Picks Are Companies Backed by Massive US Government Stakes

headline: L3Harris Wins US$400m THAAD Deal As Valuation Looks Fair
summary: L3Harris Technologies (NYSE:LHX) received a new US$400 million contract to supply missile defense components. The award covers solid rocket boost motors and Liquid Divert and Attitude Control Systems for the THAAD missile defense system. The contract highlights L3Harris's role as a supplier within core U.S. national security programs. L3Harris Technologies, traded as NYSE:LHX, is a defense and aerospace contractor focused on communications, space, and mission systems for government and...

headline: Is L3Harris Technologies (LHX) Fairly Priced After Strong 1-Year Share Price Surge?
summary: If you are wondering whether L3Harris Technologies at around US$346.59 is offering fair value or stretching expectations, you are not alone. This article is built to help you unpack that question clearly. The stock has been relatively flat over the last 30 days at 0.0%, but its 13.8% year-to-date return and 80.5% return over the past year give important context for how the market is currently pricing the company. Recent news around the defense sector, including ongoing focus on government...
